As reported by the House Committee on Armed Services on

cboCostEstimates.title: H.R. 4350, National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2022

constitutionalAuthorityStatementText:
[Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 116 (Friday, July 2, 2021)]
[House]
[Pages H3606-H3607]
From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]
By Mr. SMITH of Washington:
H.R. 4350.
Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant
to the following:
The constitutional authority on which this bill rests is
the power of Congress ``to provide for the common Defence'',
``to raise and support Armies'', ``to provide and maintain a
Navy'' and ``to make Rules for the Government and Regulation
of the land and naval
[[Page H3607]]
Forces'' as enumerated in Article I, section 8 of the United
States Constitution.

latestAction.text: Returned to the Calendar. Calendar No. 144.

title: National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2022
